function.arguments:
{"command":"str_replace","path":"/workspace/solution.py","old_str":"n = int(input())
s = input().strip()

# Count unique substrings that are repetitions of one character
unique_substrings = set()

# For each position in the string, find all substrings starting at that position
# that consist of a single repeated character
i = 0
while i < len(s):
    char = s[i]
    j = i
    # Find the end of the consecutive run of this character
    while j < len(s) and s[j] == char:
        j += 1

    # For this run of length (j - i), we can have substrings of lengths 1 to (j - i)
    # Each of these will be unique (e.g., "a", "aa", "aaa", etc.)
    run_length = j - i
    for length in range(1, run_length + 1):
        unique_substrings.add(char * length)

    i = j

print(len(unique_substrings))
","new_str":"import sys

def main():
    data = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if len(data) < 2:
        return
    s = data[1]
    n = len(s)
    max_run = [0] * 26
    i = 0
    while i < n:
        c = s[i]
        j = i
        while j < n and s[j] == c:
            j += 1
        run = j - i
        idx = ord(c) - ord('a')
        if run > max_run[idx]:
            max_run[idx] = run
        i = j
    print(sum(max_run))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

function.name: str_replace_editor

args.old_str:
n = int(input())
s = input().strip()

# Count unique substrings that are repetitions of one character
unique_substrings = set()

# For each position in the string, find all substrings starting at that position
# that consist of a single repeated character
i = 0
while i < len(s):
    char = s[i]
    j = i
    # Find the end of the consecutive run of this character
    while j < len(s) and s[j] == char:
        j += 1

    # For this run of length (j - i), we can have substrings of lengths 1 to (j - i)
    # Each of these will be unique (e.g., "a", "aa", "aaa", etc.)
    run_length = j - i
    for length in range(1, run_length + 1):
        unique_substrings.add(char * length)

    i = j

print(len(unique_substrings))
args.new_str:
import sys

def main():
    data = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if len(data) < 2:
        return
    s = data[1]
    n = len(s)
    max_run = [0] * 26
    i = 0
    while i < n:
        c = s[i]
        j = i
        while j < n and s[j] == c:
            j += 1
        run = j - i
        idx = ord(c) - ord('a')
        if run > max_run[idx]:
            max_run[idx] = run
        i = j
    print(sum(max_run))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
